block.p: Re ''Politely, Lazio and Mrs. Clinton Debate U.N. and Supreme Court'' (front page, Oct. 9):

Hillary Rodham Clinton, during Sunday's debate, stated that overturning Roe v. Wade would end a woman's right to choose. That is not true. Rather, such an action by the Supreme Court would allow for the states to enact laws to make abortion illegal, which they may or may not do.
Re ''Politely, Lazio and Mrs. Clinton Debate U.N. and Supreme Court'' (front page, Oct. 9):

Hillary Rodham Clinton, during Sunday's debate, stated that overturning Roe v. Wade would end a woman's right to choose. That is not true. Rather, such an action by the Supreme Court would allow for the states to enact laws to make abortion illegal, which they may or may not do.
And if, as claimed by the pro-choice advocates, Roe v. Wade is supported by a majority of the people, state legislatures would probably be reluctant to pass such laws.
JIM HAGAR Woodland Hills, Calif., Oct. 9, 2000
